column5: Gee I kind of like Old Mill beer. Didn't think it was bad for that ponypiss the yanks try to call beer. wink wink nudge nudge
just in case someone is having a beverage of their choice...a little sumthin to warsh er down!
It's the advice that Bob Pinciotti gave to Eric Foreman on "That 70's Show"  when Eric was going to fight someone....  Always sounded like good advice to me...

Must be getting old, remember $4.95 for a 24 in Ontario including 2 cents deposit per bottle, of course the drinking age then was 21 here, but we lived close to the N.Y. border and the age there was only 18
I bought a 6pack of Old Mill at the Ramada across from MLG during the beer strike and paid $22. That stands as the most ripped off I've ever been.
You want to feel ripped off on a daily basis move to the NWT!!! We are being hosed $64 for a two four. I don't drink much any more.
Dude......you need to set a side some fishing time for brewing time...at those prices you could be rich overnight...

Billy Bob this discussion is moot. Your $16 case of beer at 3% - 3.5% is almost equal to or $38 case at 5%. About 15 years ago me and 2 buddies went down to a country music festival (We-fest) in North Dakota (I think) and when we pulled out of the store (I think it was a Pamida) we had over 100 beer each for 3 days. We ran out on the Sunday afternoon and had to rely on the consession stands for the Sunday night shows. As you can tell by my recollection I can't remeber all the details...maybe it was all the beer...but I think we had a good time. I ended up climbing into the wrong tent and passing out between 2 strangers sleeping in a double bag. They were some pissed when I finally awoke to the dude yelling at me and the girl pulling my hair.   .
...american beer makes me pee alot ...just imagine ....oh never mind...lol..
I wouldn't pay 50 cents for 100 cans of that American swill,or beer flavoured water.The only thing that crap does is make your bladder work overtime yuk!
You do realize the American Brewery "Coors" now owns Molson's...
American beer ..... kind of like sex in a canoe.

Im no beer ace, which is a good thing...........you can give me a coors light, a bud light, a sam adams, a brador, a molson canadian, a heinekin, a XXX, and it all tastes the same to me. As long as its cold as ice and goin down after a hot day of fishin.........its all the same "swill".  You can throw me any beer out of the cooler you like and I wont even look at the label.  American, canadian.....dont matter...Just keep it iced. After all, if ya forget about it in the trunk it all tastes like possum piss anyway
Blaque, ice cold drinks are very bad for you. If we were meant to drink cold stuff, breasts would be refrigerated.
Dang fine idea if you ask me
reminds me of my "fridged" exes....speaking of Ex.....beer was meant to be served at room temp
Then who started all this milk in the refrigerator and "best if sold by" on the milk carton
Probably a beer drinker.
Old Milwaukee ,said by the medical people,will stunt yer growth if drank for a long period of time.
Judging by obesity rates in America, Old Mil certainly contributes to growth as well!
Yeah...I was at Walmart in Flint last week....24's for 14.99...needless to say I picked up 3...can get a 24 of cans at home for less than $25 really...
NOT TRUE... because when breast are chilled the taps pop out...  Oh boy.....I think I'm going to get another warning...but well worth it...
I promise you it ain't the Old Mil that is causing obesity. Besides we don't drink much Old Mil it is horrible tasting....  Art
It's called buck a beer...
That's why we now calls it Molson American.
To settle a argument....since I haven't purchased beer in Ontario in probably 20 years how much is a case of Molson Canadian ?
24 bottles are $38.50.  http://www.thebeerstore.ca/Beers/pricelist.asp?str=&id=0651&brandname=CANADIAN
Thanks, I thought it was pushing $40 per case but wasn't sure.....the older you get the less you can remember...

Revised American Dream  Nice house White Picket fence Personal pond loaded with ten pound bass Cottage in Canada 600 HP Bass Boat Father -in-law that owns a liquor store and likes to fish Wife that has bodasious ta tas and never talks back Mistress that has bodasious ta tas and never says "no" Ripper bar within walking distance (right beside a river that is infested with salmon /bows/ coho and muskey Sit on a sunny sunday afternoon and argue with life long buddies over the price of beer in Canada   Cheers Billy Bob  -who won the argument ?   edit to add.......600 HP woodsplitter
The more beer I drank, the more I forgot too
the more i wanted to forget...but seem to keep get reminded of ....on a regular basis...
They have shots for that
it was always the shots that cause the problems...lol...
I blame my memory on Labatt's Blue Light....do you think I could sue them for that......  that? ? ? what were we taking about again. Oh, that's right, log splitters.....
nope ...sueing is an AMERICANO THANG!
But Labatt's headquarters are here in Buffalo, NY U.S.A.
and you can keep them there.  but do ask them to do something on the price for us Canucks would ya?
Last case of beer I bought cost me $9.75 and the last pack of smokes was $1.85. You would think I'd be rich with all the money I've saved since 1984.

Last week our super market "Tops" had Blue Light on sale for a price I haven't seen in about 5 years.....$16.99 per 30 pack and that wasn't a rebated price but rather the price paid at the cash register....I hogged 5 cases thinking I am saving $4 per case, so if I purchase 5 cases one is FREE (my favorite 4 letter word)...  I wish I could  do something about the prices you guys pay up there on adult beverages but I don't think they would listen......you need more competition on the retail side other then the "Beer Store". Here beer is sold almost everywhere from super markets to drug stores to gas stations.
I thought we only rented the stuff
Tops never stops...........saving you more
Each retailer is different, but Old Milwaukee should cost around $16.29 for a 30 pack! US prices! My beer budget is about 15 bucks every 3 years or so.
They don't have Topps in Buffalo, only Tapps
When I was young and had more bills then money I use to drink Old Milwaukee...I believe we got for $4.99 per 24 pack on sale. Now when I taste it I know why...
Dem's fightin' words, Billy.

why am i reminder of the lions words from the wizard of oz..."cmon ....put em up....ill take ya on with one hand behind my baaaaaaaaaak"  Just messin around Roy   Cheers!!!! even if it is a Milwaukee!
Auntie Em, Hate you, hate Kansas, taking the dog. Dorothy. ...
If you can stomach Old Milwaukee you have to be stronger then me so I'll have to hit you with a banjo when you're not looking.....
now im reminded of " The Deliverance"...
Are you related to Quick Draw McGraw's alter ego "El Kabong"?
